sub_title: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)
summary: Motivated, passionate and culturally sensitive project manager at CIS-VU with a background in social and cultural anthropology and teaching. Working in the field of international collaboration, mostly in the MENA region focusing on Education and SRHR related capacity sharing (building) projects. Expertise in diversity issues, SRHR, Gender awareness, tailor-made training and teaching practices. Previously also worked in Indonesia and Bangladesh. For an overview of the long-term projects I am working see 'projects' below.

education.degree_name: Short Course - Organising effective responses for Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights

school.name: Zuyd Hogeschool | Zuyd University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Basic and Advanced training on Management of Development Projects and Programmes for JUST staff and Syrian stakeholders in Jordan
projects.description: This project aims to develop and raise the efficiency of the university administration and enhance and evaluate institutional performance. As a result  JUST and its Syrian stakeholders will have a core body of well-trained staff that are more successful in the development, acquisition and execution of the projects, project management duties and conflict resolution.

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: Qualitative Research Methodologies: Learning by Doing
projects.description: The Qualitative Research Methodology Training “Learning by doing” is based on the principle that the most effective way to grasp the intricacies regarding qualitative research is by applying the recently obtained knowledge into practice. Participants associated with the Refugees, Displaced Persons and Forced Migration Studies Center (RDFMSC) – Yarmouk University  will receive (basic) principles and methods in qualitative research which will be applied in a mini-research project done in groups. The training consists of three modules as part of phase 1. In the next modules participants will gain tools and practice with both qualitative as well as quantitative (forecasting and modelling) research data to write policy briefs (Phase 2). Finally participants will enhance their training competencies (ToT approaches).

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: Brighter Futures: Supporting Lebanese TVET Institutions and organisations to enhance quality education for refugee students and host communities
projects.description:
This project aims to strengthen TVET institutions in Lebanon to enhance quality education and psycho-social support services for students with a refugee background and host communities. 

Services provided a.o. are:
- Setting-up an online learning environment/blended learning 
- Capacity-building in teaching social entrepreneurship skills
- Psychosocial support services (PSS)
- Setting-up a multi-stakeholder platform

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: INCLUDE: Towards more Sustainable Services and Solutions to SRHR needs for Youth and Refugees in Jordan
projects.description: The INCLUDE-project aims to improve the response to SRHR needs at the community level in Jordan, youth and Syrian refugees in particular by increasing knowledge and skills of participants in relation to SRHR, gender equity perspectives, health systems thinking, and generation and use of evidence in decision making and implementation of SRHR and programmes.

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: STITCH: SRHR Tailor-made Information and Training to Contribute to Occupational Health and safety conditions of factory workers in the Ready-Made Garment Sector in Bangladesh
projects.description: The STITCH-project  is focused on improving the SRHR of garment workers in Bangladesh. This group is facing many sexual reproductive health issues, such as unintended pregnancies and related abortions, gender based violence, sexual transmitted infections, etc. while many of the (female) garment workers are young, and not able to access youth friendly SRH services.

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: CYBER: Cyber-Security Education in Indonesia through a Multidisciplinary Approach of Study Programs and Innovative Technologies
projects.description:
The Cyber-Project will provide solutions for strengthening the capacity, knowledge and quality of cybersecurity education in Indonesia by offering multi-disciplinary study programs which use innovative and practise-oriented techniques.
The partners of this project will lay the foundation of the first nationally disseminated multi-disciplinary cybersecurity curriculum. The newly created study programs based on this curriculum will be offered in a unique academic setting, in laboratory type classrooms, where participants will benefit from hands-on experiences, as well as from diverse cybersecurity insights delivered by technical experts (engineers, IT professionals and computer science academics) combined with non-technical experts (legal professionals, criminologists, sociologists or experts in management and politics).

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: Enhancing Democracy and Citizen’s Trust in Governance: Adopting a Fair Treatment Approach in Indonesia’s Ombudsman Offices
projects.description: This sub-project aims to contribute to democratization and to a more effective rule of law through the implementation of a Fair Treatment Approach at the Ombudsman of the Republic of Indonesia.  The rationale of the  Fair Treatment Approach, when applied by the  is that it improves the attitude of civil servants towards citizens from one of suspicion, into one of empathy and shared interest, while at the same time it enhances trust of citizens in the government. The experience of the National Ombudsman in the Netherlands has shown that the adoption of the Fair Treatment Approach asks for a profound cultural change throughout the organization, that needs attention and training over a longer period of time. This project aims to set up a road map for the successful introduction of the Fair Treatment Approach in, first of all, ORI offices in Indonesia, therewith taking into account regional differences. Since ORI has gender equality as one of its priorities, this approach will offer more insight in what is at stake for different groups within society, be it women, minorities or other disadvantaged groups.

contributors.headline: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU) at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)

projects.title: UN/DIVIDED Conference
projects.description: Organisation of the first UN/DIVIDED Conference at Wijnhaven, Turfmarkt 99 in The Hague. Motivated by the desire to offer student perspectives on heated diversity debates, this national conference seeks to bring students together. The goal is to kick the academic year off with a day in which we share experiences, doubts, worries and dreams.

profile_positions.description: For the long-term projects I am working on see an overview at the bottom -> accomplishments -> projects.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU)

profile_positions.description: Daily activities involve project management, coordination, administration and project reporting; acquisition and developing project proposals, planning and organising training workshops (including logistics) and policy development.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader, Centre for International Cooperation (CIS-VU)

profile_positions.description: The Centre for International Cooperation (CIS) at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU) supports and promotes the university’s strategy of internationalization and diversity. In a broader sense, CIS-VU embodies the university’s commitment to society, supporting and facilitating research, education and outreach for the benefit of people, planet and prosperity. The themes in which CIS-VU operates are in line with the profiling themes of VU and involve sustainable development, governance, social inclusiveness, food, life and health and the environment. CIS-VU facilitates, supports and coordinates these efforts and has relevant links to a vast international network of partners in developing and emerging countries: academic institutions, small and medium enterprises, industry partners and civil society.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Project Lala Salama is a private development initiative founded by three students from Amsterdam, Claartje de Rooij, Maurice Schreiner & Marie- Claire Breuning. They help the children from the orphanage 'Teule' in Kenya and try to make the home self-sustainable by creating projects like providing a watertank, drip-irrigation system, starting a farm with cows and goats, creating a study room for the children and many more projects.
They raise funds throughout the whole year from all over the world.

Contribution: 
Fundraising. 
Planning and organizing.
Initiating the farm project. Building a cow shed in collaboration with Teule Kenya. 
Coordinating the construction team on the ground. 
Field trip and activities with the kids. 
Starting project Pen Pals with the 1e Openluchtschool of Amsterdam

http://www.projectlalasalama.com/

Mentor ship for one of UAF's projects 'Refugees@campus'. Helping a student from Iran at the VU on a weekly basis with for example homework for the VASVU program. Being a buddy and assisting with general practicalities as well as socializing to make the student feel welcome and comfortable at the university setting and beyond.
